review_blob:
Appearance- nice big foamy head that lasted a good bit. No lacing. Semi clear/hazy. Honey gold. 

Smell- clean, crisp. Strong malts up front. Moderately hoppy. 

Taste- malty, sweet up front. Pleasant bitterness on the back. 

Mouthfeel- light to medium body, creamy, smooth. 

Overall- very nice. Nothing too complex (as its designed). An easy drinker with good qualities, especially the taste given the reasonable (low) 5.8% ABV. Would have again and definitely recommend. 

Cheers!

Appearance- nice big frothy bone white head. Lasted a good bit. Very little/light lacing. Lots of bubbles. Clear honey gold hue. Ultra pleasing to the eye. 

Smell- clean, malty, hoppy. All the pleasant aromas I expect and enjoy when visiting a brewery. 

Taste- lots of malts up front, followed by nice hop bitterness. 

Mouthfeel- crisp, medium to full body.

Overall- an excellent lager. Very well balanced. Loads of character all around. Would definitely have again and recommend. 

Cheers!

Appearance- decent bone white head that lasted a good bit. Light lacing. Fairly clear (a little cloudy right out of the bottle). Honey gold hue. 

Smell- malts and spice. Clean. 

Taste- a little sweet up front (surprisingly), then on to the bitterness. The notes on the nose dont really come through, unfortunately. Disappointing.

Mouthfeel- medium body. 

Overall- okay, not great. Wouldnt go out of my way to have again. Many better options available.

Appearance- small thin bone white head. No lacing. Clear golden hue. Lots of bubbles. 

Smell- clean. Floral, bready, malty. 

Taste- sweet floral hops up front, malts in the middle, and bitter dry finish on the back end. 

Mouthfeel- light body

Overall- a very nice Pilsner from a rock solid brewery. Would recommend and have again. 

Cheers!

Appearance- moderate light mocha tan head. Some lacing (not a lot). Crystal clear mahogany brown. 

Smell- clean. Spicy, sweet malts, light ginger notes, clove.

Taste- light biscuits and malt up front, feint sweet spices on the back end. Not too much going on here. 

Mouthfeel- very light body. Creamy. Little/light carbonation. 

Overall- a nice easy drinker. Decent session ale. Would prefer it with food. 

Cheers!

Appearance- big foamy bone white head that lasted a long time. Minimal to no lacing. Lots of bubbles. Very pale golden yellow. Looked like lemon meringue pie in a glass. A great looker!

Smell-  crisp and clean. Sweet spicy malts. Feint hops. 

Taste- malty up front, sweet on the back end. Biscuity. Slight hop bitterness.

Mouthfeel- silky smooth. Light body. 

Overall- very good. Love all things Lagunitas, but Im not a Pils guy (love me some IPAs!!!); however, I know a good Pilsner when I drink one. Has officially dethroned the Scrimshaw as my favorite Pilsner. This is a great offering from one of the best breweries. Would have again and definitely recommend. 

Cheers!

Appearance- nice big frothy (light) mocha colored head that lasted a good bit with (surprisingly) minimal lacing. Medium dark mahogany brown. Fairly clear.

Smell- holy smoke!!! The nose was overwhelming immediately after pouring. All I can think of is the aromas experienced while waiting to be seated in a BBQ joint. 

Taste- bacon/pork, jerky.

Mouthfeel- medium body. Smooth and creamy. 

Overall- good, different. Would have again but only with the right food/meal. Recommend for no other reason than to experience this unique brew.

Cheers!

Appearance- clear honey gold. A not too big bone white head. Minimal lacing. 

Smell- Belgian yeast. Floral. Sweet.

Taste- spices and clove. Sweet (butterscotch?). Maybe a little nutty.

Mouthfeel- medium body. Not much going on here.

Overall- not bad (but not great). An interesting offering for a winter seasonal. A nice Belgian style brew from an American brewery. Id have again but wouldnt go out of my way, especially if better Belgian beers are an option. Seems like a beer that could please/disappoint depending on the palate, so I recommend trying.

Cheers!
beer_name: Flying Fish Grand Cru Winter Reserve

review_blob:
Appearance- semi clear/opaque (dark but let a little light through). Dark Amber, mahogany brown. Big bubbly mocha head that lasted a good bit. Nice lacing.

Smell- clean, malty, spices and clove. Dark chocolate.

Taste- bitter, toasted malt, spicy (and sweet). 

Mouthfeel- light body (surprisingly). Smooth and creamy. Very little carbonation. 

Overall- so so/ok. After seeing and smelling, the mouthfeel and taste disappointed. Was expecting more. Not a bad beer, but nothing noteworthy. 

Cheers!

Appearance- clear honey gold. Decent medium bone white head that lasted a good bit. A little lacing, not much. Very pleasing/inviting to the eye.

Smell- clean, piney, floral, hoppy, citrus (grapefruit). 

Taste- bitter hops up front. Malty, biscuity on the end. Big citrus wallop (grapefruit on the nose carries to the taste, big time).

Mouthfeel- medium body. Well balanced. A good bit going on here but very consistent throughout. 

Overall- excellent! An outstanding IPA. Was a gateway beer for me several years ago when first getting used to this style, and has remained a "Big 4" for me over time (the other 3? Lagunitas Lil Sumpin, Bells Two Hearted, 21st Ammendment Brew Free or Die). Also, very reasonably priced ($7.99 at Total Wine). An additional note, visit the brewery if you have the opportunity. A great tour and tasting room. 

Cheers!

Appearance- nice moderate foamy mocha latte head that lasted a good bit, but left very little lacing. Very, very dark/opaque (zero light getting through) black/brown. Outstanding. 

Smell- coffee, toasted malt, caramel. A little cocoa. 

Taste- coffee, dark chocolate. Starts off bitter, gets a little sweet in the middle, then the bitterness kicks in (again) on the finish. Very good.

Mouthfeel- big, full body. Smooth and creamy.

Overall- excellent!!! A super stout. Another great beer from Green Flash. Will be having again and would highly recommend.

Cheers!

Appearance- semi clear amber, copper. Small bone white head that didnt last long. Minimal lacing. 

Smell- clean. Very malty, bready, and sugary. A little spice, too.

Taste- sweet and spicy. The malt, bread, and sugar on the nose come through completely. 

Mouthfeel- a little rough around the edges (going in) with a surprisingly smooth and creamy finish. Medium body.

Overall- just ok (for me). A so so Marzen. Nothing great, nothing offensive. 

Cheers!

Appearance- fairly dark, semi clear, mahogany, cola brown. Thin mocha colored head that didnt last long. Little to no lacing. 

Smell- clean. Malt and spices. Dark and toasty. Light chocolate notes.

Taste- bready, caramel, cocoa. 

Mouthfeel- smooth and creamy. Crisp. Light bodied.

Overall- very good/nice. An above average schwarzbier. Would recommend and have again.

Cheers!

Appearance- nice bone white head that didnt last too long. Minimal lacing. Clear, amber, copper.

Smell- clean, malty, bready.

Taste- bitter, spicy (ginger), caramel, malt.

Mouthfeel- medium to full body. Very crisp.

Overall- good, not great. Nothing offensive, but have had better Marzens. Worth a try, but wouldnt have again.

Cheers!

Appearance- big foamy ivory white head that lasted a long time and left pretty decent lacing. Clear, amber, honey gold. Most appealing. 

Smell- clean, malty, bready, (slightly) spicy.

Taste- toasted malts, biscuity, caramel. Very, very pleasant. 

Mouthfeel- light, smooth. Excellent balance.

Overall- very nice. A solid brew. Never used to be a big fan of Marzen/Oktoberfest, but starting to enjoy more and more. Would have again (and again) and definitely recommend.

Cheers!

Appearance- fairly decent foamy light tan head that lasted a good bit. Nice lacing. Clear mahogany brown. Very inviting. 

Smell- clean, spicy, malt, ginger. 

Taste- toasted malt. Slightly sugary. Hints of caramel and fig.

Mouthfeel- light, smooth, creamy. Very good balance.

Overall- very nice/pleasant. Enjoyable throughout. One of the better Vienna lagers available in wide release. Would go well with many meals (very food friendly), or all alone. Something Id be glad to serve others who may not have the broadest of beer palates (i.e. parties, picnics, etc.) Not what I normally reach for, but would definitely have again.

Cheers!

Appearance- big foamy bubbly head that lasted a little bit with minimal lacing (almost none). Cloudy golden yellow hue. 

Smell- pungent, barnyard, funky (in a not bad way). The lactobacillus and brett are uber present. Sours not a smell but the aroma hints at a good bit of tartness to come. 

Taste- more tangy than tart. Yeasty but not biscuity. Sour fruits (green apples, lemons). Like unsweetened lemonade.

Mouthfeel- light, clean, crisp.

Overall- interesting. Havent had enough of this style so reluctant to weigh in heavily. Overall, enjoyed the experience and look forward to trying more Berlinerweiss. Would only recommend to a true enthusiast, or maybe someone who thinks he/she "doesnt like beer."

Cheers!

Appearance- big bone white head that lasted a good bit. Not much lacing. Lots of bubbles/carbonation. Clear honey gold. Nice to look at.

Smell- clean, malty. Slightly pungent.

Taste- toasted malt (the name dont lie!), biscuity, feint hops.

Mouthfeel- light, crisp, well carbonated. Creamy.

Overall- Im not much of a lager guy, leaning heavily toward ales and more complex beers, but this was a very solid easy drinker. Most enjoyable. Great with food (wings, pizza, burgers) or on its own. Would have again and recommend.

Cheers!

Appearance- light tan bubbly head (like a mocha latte). Dissipated quickly and minimal lacing. Fairly dark, mahogany, amber, copper.

Smell- clean, malty, sweet, fruit (raisins), spices. Sherry-like. Very pleasant.

Taste- reminded me of a scotch ale. Sweet, malty, caramel.

Mouthfeel- light to medium body. Creamy. Well balanced.

Overall- a very nice beer. A good effort by a great brewery at a Dopplebock. Most impressed by the evenly balanced mouthfeel given the various aromas and tastes happening in this brew. Would have again and definitely recommend.

Cheers!

Appearance- dark, dark, dark mocha/mahogany brown. Big, tan, frothy long lasting head. Very little lacing (if any). 

Smell- nutty, chocolate, ginger, caramel.

Taste- deep dark chocolate (very much like high % cacao), fig, coffee. Sweetness up front, bitter on the back. 

Mouthfeel- smooth, silky, medium body.

Overall- outstanding! Excellent! A great Dopplebock. Would absolutely recommend. 

Cheers!

Appearance- semi cloudy, hazy golden yellow. Moderate bone white head that didnt last long and left minimal lacing.

Smell- citrus (grapefruit), piney hops, herbaceous. 

Taste- tart, citrus (lots of grapefruit and a little lemon).

Mouthfeel- well balanced. Light to medium body. Silky.

Overall- a solid brew. Would recommend and have again!

Cheers!
beer_name: Starr Hill Whiter Shade of Pale Ale

review_blob:
Appearance- poured picture perfect. Cloudy straw gold. Big foamy ivory head that lasted forever (5+ minutes). Decent/moderate lacing.

Smell- clean, spicy (the Old Bay seasoning is very evident but not overwhelming), peppery. 

Tasty- salty!!! The slight presence of Old Bay on the nose is uber present on the tongue. More malty than hoppy. A little pepper on the back end. Very different in a good/interesting way.

Mouthfeel- light, smooth, and a little creamy.

Overall- I like it! Went in slightly skeptical and came out more than pleasantly surprised. This is a local (favorite) place for me that brews a lot of high quality stuff, so not surprised they could make this work. Would be even better if enjoyed with food (burgers, jerk chicken). Would definitely have again. I recommend it to all, especially fellow enthusiasts. 

Cheers!

Appearance- hazy, opaque, honey, orange, amber. Nice big foamy bone white head that remained for a good while. Superb lacing. 

Smell- clean, spice, clove, malt, Belgian yeast aroma.

Taste- bitter, spicy, (slight) sour citrus bite. Tangy.

Mouthfeel- creamy, medium body, well balanced.

Overall- an excellent beer! A very good U.S. version of a Belgian pale. Highly recommend.

Cheers!
beer_name: Lickinghole Creek Magic Beaver Belgian-Style Pale Ale

review_blob:
Appearance- clear, copper, amber. Small to medium bone white head that lasted a good bit. Light lacing.

Smell-not much of a nose. Malty and bready. Clean. Light roast.

Taste- like the nose, malty and bready. Raisiny sweet. 

Mouthfeel- thin, light.

Overall- just ok. Nothing special. Wont be purchasing again. 

Cheers!

Appearance- dark mahogany brown. Small thin head that disappeared quickly. Just about no lacing.

Smell- clean, light, biscuity. 

Taste- almost nothing going on here. I struggled to identify any character other than feint maltiness (and a tiny bit of sweetness). 

Mouthfeel- thin, ultra light bodied, watery.

Overall- barely even OK. Disappointing. For home consumption? Absolutely not! For mass consumption? Fine (i.e. tailgating, BBQs), especially if its hot outside and the beer is ice cold (to help hide its deficiencies). 

Cheers!

Appearance- clear. Amber, copper. Good amount of bubbles. Small bone white head that lasted a bit. Not much lacing.

Smell- clean, malty. Not a whole lot going on here.

Taste- malt and cola. Sweet. Bready aftertaste. Subtle bitterness.

Mouthfeel- light body. Light carbonation. Creamy.

Overall- just OK (for me). Might be that Im just not a bock guy. Wont be having again.

Cheers!

Appearance- medium to dark (root beer) brown. Nice tan head. Light to moderate dissipation with some lacing, but nothing noteworthy. 

Smell- clean. Roasted coffee. Caramel and malt. Mineral quality (similar to an oyster stout). 

Taste- burnt coffee, cocoa, 

Mouthfeel- light body. Not too much carbonation. Bitter up front. Very crisp. 

Overall- good. Would recommend and have again. A solid American version of a classic German style. 

Cheers!

Appearance- clear, light gold. Big frothy bone white head (meringue like) that dissipated slowly. Excellent lacing.

Smell- clean, piney, hoppy, floral.

Taste- bitter, citrus/grapefruit, piney, spicy, tangy.

Mouthfeel- lightly carbonated. Medium body. Dry.

Overall- another very good, high quality offering from Lagunitas. Definitely worth having (again and again). 

Cheers!
beer_name: Lagunitas A Little Sumpin Extra! Ale

review_blob:
Appearance- pours with some viscosity. Dark tan, foamy (milkshake like) head. Minimal lacing. Very dark, like black coffee. 

Smell- clean, spicy, malt, gingerbread.

Taste- chocolate, coffee, toasted malty sweetness.

Mouthfeel- super silky smooth and creamy (like chocolate milk). Big and full. Outstanding balance. Bitter in the middle with a pleasant, warm finish. 

Overall- excellent! Another superb offering from Stone. Definitely worth purchasing. Highly recommend. 

Cheers!

Appearance- cloudy, honey gold hue. Nice bone white head. Not too much lacing. An overall inviting look. 

Smell- clean, spicy, clove, caramel, malt, banana. 

Taste- pungent Belgian yeast, bready malts, definitely spiced (had a rum feel thing going on). Light citrusy hops. 

Mouthfeel- tart and creamy (an unusual combination). Medium to full bodied. 

Overall- a very nice beer. Another solid offering g from Boulevard. Would recommend and would buy again. If youre reading this, heres an extra tip/suggestion: try the Boulevard Tank 7 Farmhouse Ale. Its awesome!
beer_name: Boulevard Smokestack Series - Long Strange Tripel

review_blob:
Appearance- clear chocolaty brown with a slight amber tint. Nice big tan foamy head that dissipates slowly. Excellent lacing.

Smell- biscuity, clean, spicy. Very up front Belgian yeast.

Taste- a good bit going on in here. Nice complexities. Caramel, malt, and some sour (fruit) notes on the end. What hits me up front, oddly, is what seems like a cola taste. Interesting. 

Mouthfeel- silky, smooth, and very creamy from the first sip all the way through to the end. Light to medium. Lightly carbonated. Outstanding!

Overall- very good. Excellent example of a quality Belgian Dubbel thats reasonably priced. Would definitely recommend and purchase again.

Cheers!

Appearance- cloudy (almost unfiltered), nice bone white head with great lacing, amber and copper hue.

Smell- Mango! Mango! Mango! Awesome nose! Pine and some grass too.

Taste- moderately bitter, amps up after swallowing and beyond. Excellent finish. Malty.

Mouthfeel- very very full. Drinks like a big boy. Not light at 9.5%, but feels like it should be 10 or above. 

Overall- excellent! A keeper. Highly recommend. 

Cheers all!
beer_name: Uinta Detour Double India Pale Ale

review_blob:
Appearance- cloudy, straw, gold. Big bone white uber foamy head. Excellent lacing. 

Smell- fruity (banana) and floral aromas dominate, followed by some grass and a little bread. 

Taste- complex with quite a bit going on (earthy, malty, spicey). What stands out is the bitter aftertaste dominated by grapefruit. Awesome!

Mouthfeel- medium, crisp, outstanding balance.

Overall- excellent!!! Not to be missed. A quality quaff.

Cheers all!
beer_name: Boulevard Smokestack Series - Tank 7 Farmhouse Ale

review_blob:
Appearance- the best thing about this beer is the appearance. Id never had it before and got my hopes up after seeing it in the glass (tulip). A beautiful amber and gold hue with a huge foamy ivory head that lasted forever, and excellent lacing. Fairly cloudy/hazy, unfiltered look. 

Smell- not much going on here, unfortunately. Sorry. I really struggled to identify noteworthy characteristics. Simply put, it smelled like beer (and reminded me more of a pilsner). 

Taste- again, not a lot (if anything) that stood out. Bitter with some light bread notes. Very disappointing, given how great it looked in the glass. 

Mouthfeel- light, crisp.

Overall- not bad, but not anything more than "ok" for me. 

Cheers all!

Appearance- good looking, dark brown, opaque. Thin (weak) root beer colored head, disappeared fairly quick. 

Smell- malt, spice, chocolate.

Taste- a little hop, bitter, gingerbread cookie.

Mouthfeel- light to medium. Thin. Warm bourbon barrel kind of feel.

Overall- a very solid, good beer. Recommendable. Ive always been a fan of Sam Smiths Nut Brown Ale, and I think this is better. 

Cheers all!

Appearance- big big frothy ivory white head. Lasts and lasts. Not much lacing. Cloudy straw tinted yellow. 

Smell- banana!!! Sugary scented wheat and barley. Clove. I loved the smell of this. It reminded me of the smells associated when visiting a brewery. 

Taste- spicy, crisp, banana, slight citrus.

Mouthfeel- light, smooth, great balance.

Overall- a very good beer. I consider Schneider Weisse hefeweizen to be the gold standard. This doesnt measure up, in my opinion, but it is a very solid beer. Nobody does it better than the Germans. 

Cheers!

Appearance- cloudy, copper, burnt amber. Nice frothy bone white head that remains for a good bit and laces nicely.

Smell- citrus,malt, and pine.

Taste- big and bitter up front, eases into spiced pepper finish. 

Mouthfeel- medium bodied. Semi smooth. 

Overall- a good to very good IPA. Wont overly wow you, but definitely shouldnt displease, either. Solid marks all around. Each time I tasted, I wanted to give greater praise, but found myself holding back. Still, dont let that stop you. Bottom line: enjoyed it very much, and will be purchasing again. 

Cheers all!

Appearance- semi cloudy/hazy, honey gold hue. Decent foamy bone white head that dissipates evenly and leaves good lacing. 

Smell- its got that "cat pee" thing going on. Obvious welcome overwhelming piney, resiny nose. 

Taste- hop hop hoppy! Perfect level of bitterness. Pine upfront that lasts throughout with a little bit of a sweet honey center.

Mouthfeel- so smooth! Big (but not too big), full flavored. Goes down easy for a DIPA (could get in trouble with this one if not keeping count). 

Overall- excellent! Outstanding! Theres a lot going on in this beer, without too much going on (you know what I mean). Get it! Enjoy it! 

Cheers all!

Appearance- ivory white foamy head that lasts for a good bit. Decent lacing left behind. Semi clear/semi cloudy golden hue. 

Smell- sweet notes of honey with a floral touch. A little light citrus tinge. 

Taste- loads of piney hops, citrus, and a bitter resin finish.

Mouthfeel- very full,very bitter, very spicey. Big, big bite! 

Overall- an excellent brew! One of my favorites. Definitely not an entry level IPA, so anyone drinking it (or reading/reviewing it) likely isnt a craft beer rookie. I enjoy it as much as some of the other top notch releases that are limited/seasonal, so love that its a year round offering.

Cheers all!

Appearance- gold, copper, amber hue. Semi- clear/cloudy (even 20 min. after pouring into tulip). Decent vanilla white head, disappeared quickly but left a healthy foam lace that remained for a good bit. 

Smell- nothing that jumped out immediately/obviously. Faint lemon and grass notes. 

Taste- very light, lemony, grass taste. Nothing to strongly praise or pan. Will be helped greatly if accompanying food/meal. 

Mouthfeel- light (to medium, at most). No strong/obvious impressions, otherwise.

Overall- this beer? So so. Just ok for me. Most of the stuff I drink, that I dont love, would still far outweigh the mass produced crap. In here, compared to the better stuff, Id leave this one alone. But, dont ignore the rest of Flying Dogs offerings. This is a strong producer of excellent craft beers (i.e. Raging Bitch Belgian IPA, Gonzo Imperial Porter, Pearl Necklace Oyster Stout, In Heat Wheat). And, an outstanding experience if you visit the brewery for a tour followed by the post tour visit to the tasting room. Go! 

Cheers all!

A- cloudy, amber, copper hue. Bone white head/foam, disappears pretty quick, but leaves a nice lace. 

Smell- caramel, sugar, malt. The nose suggests a heavier taste is to follow, but that is not the case.

Taste- bitter right out of the gate, moved to some sour notes in the middle, then finished with more of the bitterness on the back end. Had trouble defining the favors that stood out, other than an overwhelming malt backbone with some citrus lurking. 

Mouthfeel- medium, unassuming.

Overall- good/very good. Im a big fan of this beer. Might come as a little bit of a surprise, given the less than stellar review. Its the kind of beer I could easily see someone else snubbing completely, but thats the beauty of adhering to the bottom line: its a good beer if it tastes good to you. Drink it if you can, as its a local offering here in the DC/VA/MD metro area.

Cheers!

4-20-14 Enjoy By

Appearance- fairly clear (a tad hazy), copper, orange hue. Appealing. 

Smell- excellent nose. Pine!!!! Some grass, too. Some floral notes to boot. 

Taste- big full wallop of resin (and that pine), lingers throughout. Bitter soon follows and strengthens at the end. Didnt note much of the citrus thing, unfortunately, compared to some the other reviews.

Mouthfeel- big, full, dry.

Overall- Im a sucker for Stone (love Ruination!), and easily fall prey to the "enjoy by" campaign, so Im a lock to try each offering. Not sure how long theyve been doing this (started last year, I think), but I really, really liked the one I had in 13. That said, Im glad I bought the 4-20-14. I "enjoyed" it, but wont be picking up another. A quality IPA, indeed, but not worth another round. Look forward to future offerings. 

Cheers all!

Appearance- thin, small white head that dissipated quickly. Very little lacing (almost none). 

Smell- clean, floral, spicy, slightly vinous. 

Taste- decent balance. Tangy, crisp, light citrus zest.

Mouthfeel- light, crisp, dry.

Overall- good. Not too complex. Surprised it clocked in at 6.1% ABV. A good summer sipper. Havent had a lot saisons to weigh in with a heavy critique, but have sampled enough to know theres better available. For me, wont be purchasing again, but think its worth trying.

Cheers!

Appearance- lightly carbonated. Fairly clear. Amber, copper hue. Big foamy bone white head with very good lacing. 

Smell- caramel, malt, bread. Mildly piney. Biscuity.

Taste- superb! Well balanced hops. Mild to moderately spicy. Mildly resinous. 

Mouthfeel- medium. Moderately bitter. Dry. Smooth.

Overall- excellent!!! Highly recommend. An epic shame its not a year rounder. Load up on it when the opportunity presents. Its an Imperial Amber to look at, for sure, but drinks like an imperial IPA, and a superior one. 

Cheers!
